We can get rid from static pool, by reusing dhcp
address, assigned to node initially.

General procedure for assignment of ip addresses
is not changed, but i've added one more condition
to check if ip address is in range of admin_net.ip_range
if it is - it will be reused when creating ip address
if not - address will be used from pool, it will guarantee
that patch works on upgraded environments

commit_message:
Reuse addresses from dhcp pool when possible

We can get rid from static pool, by reusing dhcp
address, assigned to node initially.

General procedure for assignment of ip addresses
is not changed, but i've added one more condition
to check if ip address is in range of admin_net.ip_range
if it is - it will be reused when creating ip address
if not - address will be used from pool, it will guarantee
that patch works on upgraded environments

Also made refactoring of old code

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1271571
Implments: blueprint get-gid-of-splitted-fueladmin-network

Change-Id: I1fcc4532faa6b255674b589ebd44534082e29c96

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-29 02:19:02.000000000', 'files': ['specs/template.rst'], 'message': 'Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Neutron REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: I21f1b9c645bd40b8c1f2e5e627c4dd5a667431dc
'}]
commit_message:
Add requirement for APIImpact flag

Adds a requirement for an APIImpact flag in
the commit message for a proposed spec if it proposes
changes to the Neutron REST API. This will make it
much easier for people such as the API WG who want to
review API changes across OpenStack to find and
review proposed API changes.

Change-Id: I21f1b9c645bd40b8c1f2e5e627c4dd5a667431dc

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-07 16:49:07.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/pre_upgrade_hooks/manager.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/pre_upgrade_hooks/from_5_1_to_any_ln_fuelweb_x86_64.py', 'fuel_upgrade_system/fuel_upgrade/fuel_upgrade/tests/test_pre_upgrade_hooks.py'], 'message': "fuel_upgrade: add hack to make repo symlink

We need to add next symlink

    repo/ubuntu/x86_64 -> repo/ubuntu/fuelweb/x86_64

in order to get working upgrade to 6.0, because in 6.0 we know nothing
about 'fuelweb' folder in repo struct, but we have it in old repos from
previous installation.

Change-Id: I7985a1f64b54bfff84df7098252448ea6ec6b613
Closes-Bug: #1390521
"}]
commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: add hack to make repo symlink

We need to add next symlink

    repo/ubuntu/x86_64 -> repo/ubuntu/fuelweb/x86_64

in order to get working upgrade to 6.0, because in 6.0 we know nothing
about 'fuelweb' folder in repo struct, but we have it in old repos from
previous installation.

Change-Id: I7985a1f64b54bfff84df7098252448ea6ec6b613
Closes-Bug: #1390521

commit_message:
Save fuel_version field for plugins model

It's important to keep all of the information
which plugin provides about dependencies.
In the future versions there might be cases
when we have to write some workaround not to
brake old plugins.

Change-Id: Id0f45def2972a60040e3a1d2a016a1ed46a05ed3
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

NetApp fix attach fail for already mapped volume

This patch fixes the error raised during mapping of a volume
to the host during attach operation if the volume is already
mapped to the host.

Closes-bug: #1310659
(cherry picked from commit dcec1b84f4d3462fc408f4152f4c89b8df79d629)

subject: Extract version definition to a separate file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-10 09:10:15.000000000', 'files': ['murano/cmd/manage.py', 'murano/common/config.py', 'murano/version.py', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'murano/__init__.py'], 'message': "Extract version definition to a separate file

Before, version was stores in the init file.
It's better not to store such kind of public data
as version to init file.
Moreover, whole murano package needed to be imported to identify project version
Now, separate file is used for that

Also, doc builder config was updated to support this change

Change-Id: Iede1dfbe9ae4d8c6fb5ecdeb8f8f25124e4bc34f
"}]
commit_message:
Extract version definition to a separate file

Before, version was stores in the init file.
It's better not to store such kind of public data
as version to init file.
Moreover, whole murano package needed to be imported to identify project version
Now, separate file is used for that

Also, doc builder config was updated to support this change

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-07 15:44:25.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Fix traceback on rare agent error case

If self._deploy_is_done() fails for any reason when called on a agent
heartbeat, 'msg' was not set, creating a traceback when trying to log
it. Let's set a default.

Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>

Change-Id: I7399821019bab4e3cf08324ee3314c40467e00a4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix traceback on rare agent error case

If self._deploy_is_done() fails for any reason when called on a agent
heartbeat, 'msg' was not set, creating a traceback when trying to log
it. Let's set a default.

Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>

Change-Id: I7399821019bab4e3cf08324ee3314c40467e00a4

commit_message:
Allow to add router interface to IPv6 SLAAC network

This patch will allow an IPv6 subnet configured with SLAAC
(or dhcpv6-stateless) to be attached to a router interface.

Closes-Bug: #1382076
Change-Id: If0c48a7287a828eef4a0f0b0859d4f898d2937bd

commit_message:
Fix missing keyboard focus from Console's iframe

The iframe in Instance Console doesn't get focus on loading, so the user
cannot type into the console, this change is focusing for console iframe
on loading

Closes-Bug: #1389117
Change-Id: Idfb731c9a00506ad4d29174d92476d10316de05c

commit_message:
Fix image-builder scripts

* Fix encoding issues
* Convert all files to UTF-8
* Fix indendation and hanging whitespaces
* Add new vairable LIBVIRT_IMAGES_DIR to be able to use faster drive for KVM images
* Fix unattended template for sysrep on Windows Server 2008 R2

Change-Id: Ifb4df8c0eeddf1698a6e4c691f48e92406bac770

The test currently fails if the the baremetal flavor has no

commit_message:
Remove ephemeral size assertion in baremetal scenario

The test currently fails if the the baremetal flavor has no
ephemeral disk set.  This removes an unnecessary assertion and
unblocks tests against environments that do not deploy ephemeral
disks.

Change-Id: I7f13d4d7b40ea8879eaa30a19c117aef284586ff

subject: Extension for moving aggregation in API layer
revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2014-10-30 15:21:15.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/rest/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/aggregates/__init__.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_aggregation.py', 'requirements.txt', 'gnocchi/aggregates/rolling_statistics.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py', 'setup.cfg', 'gnocchi/storage/file.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py'], 'message': "Extension for moving aggregation in API layer

Added extension for moving average, moving variance,
ewma. Unit tests added.

Query syntax (required parameter: window. optional: center,
resolution):

    GET /v1/entity/UUID/measures?aggregation=moving-average&
	window=30S&resolution=high
or
    GET /v1/entity/UUID/measures?aggregation=ewma&window=60S

The moving aggregates are performed on the rolled-up data
with granularity that factors into the window size. Resolution
'high' finds the finest granularity data; resolution 'low'
finds the coarsest granularity data. A 404 response code
is returned for invalid or missing parameters.

Change-Id: If40e58480f1512dd17b9c09cb75fd54c7193c257
"}]
commit_message:
Extension for moving aggregation in API layer

Added extension for moving average, moving variance,
ewma. Unit tests added.

Query syntax (required parameter: window. optional: center,
resolution):

    GET /v1/entity/UUID/measures?aggregation=moving-average&
	window=30S&resolution=high
or
    GET /v1/entity/UUID/measures?aggregation=ewma&window=60S

The moving aggregates are performed on the rolled-up data
with granularity that factors into the window size. Resolution
'high' finds the finest granularity data; resolution 'low'
finds the coarsest granularity data. A 404 response code
is returned for invalid or missing parameters.

Change-Id: If40e58480f1512dd17b9c09cb75fd54c7193c257

commit_message:
allow image_id for imageRef in create volume API

This adds support for replacing the imageRef key with image_id when
creating a volume in both v1 and v2 of the Cinder API.

Closes-Bug: 1375867

Change-Id: I6770de8f70e00a3c8dc27ecf8dd88b3586b842ea

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-09 16:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['designate/api/v2/views/zones.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/tables.py', 'designate/tests/test_storage/__init__.py', 'designate/central/service.py', 'designate/objects/domain.py', 'designate/storage/impl_sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/044_add_pool_id_to_domains.py'], 'message': ' Add pool_id column to Domains Table

 This adds the pool_id column to the domains table
 along with the necessary code changes and tests as
 part of all the changes that need to be done to
 accomodate server pools

 Partially-implements: blueprint server-pools-storage

 - Migrate servers from servers table to
   poolattributes table
 - Remove all old server api code
 - Make changes to backends to use poolattribute
   nameservers instead of servers

Change-Id: I535a04cac27d1068398fd982ca14016c38cbd134
'}]
commit_message:
Add pool_id column to Domains Table

 This adds the pool_id column to the domains table
 along with the necessary code changes and tests as
 part of all the changes that need to be done to
 accomodate server pools

 Partially-implements: blueprint server-pools-storage

 - Migrate servers from servers table to
   poolattributes table
 - Remove all old server api code
 - Make changes to backends to use poolattribute
   nameservers instead of servers

Change-Id: I535a04cac27d1068398fd982ca14016c38cbd134

commit_message:
Added metadata lint and puppet-syntax gems

metadata-json-lint is a little tool to check the validity of
Puppet metatdata.json files.

puppet-syntax tool check the validity of templates,manifests and hiera
files (the goal here is to replace manual checks in the gate by a
standard? check `rake syntax`).

Change-Id: I60b9cdfe27eeb8a8f5ad3a238dd847ed3096cb6b

Netty is used for messaging.

subject: Add cassandra-driver>=2.1.1 requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-07 15:26:00.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add cassandra-driver>=2.1.1 requirement

Apache 2 licensed; needed for Cassandra support in Ceilometer

> Is the library actively maintained?

This is the official DataStax library and they actively maintain it.
https://github.com/datastax/python-driver

> Is the library good code?

Yes.

> Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

> Is the library license compatible?

Yes: Apache2

> Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest /
> Fedora latest)?

Packaged by DataStax, and in PyPi.  Not yet in Ubuntu / Fedora.

However, this is only going to be an _optional_ requirement.  If users do not
enable the Cassandra backend for Ceilometer, they will not use it.  As such,
this is a weaker requirement for packaging OpenStack.

Indeed, it would likely be inappropriate to install the Cassandra driver as part
of a default OpenStack distro, as Cassandra is not a primary datastore for any
OpenStack project.

As such, I do not believe we are requiring the distros to package it.  They may
choose to do so for the convenience of their users, but that is their choice.

> Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
> global-requirements.txt?

No

Change-Id: I5803f93be601b875fdfb8276c04e7ecebab8d08e
'}]
commit_message:
Add cassandra-driver>=2.1.1 requirement

Apache 2 licensed; needed for Cassandra support in Ceilometer

> Is the library actively maintained?

This is the official DataStax library and they actively maintain it.
https://github.com/datastax/python-driver

> Is the library good code?

Yes.

> Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

> Is the library license compatible?

Yes: Apache2

> Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest /
> Fedora latest)?

Packaged by DataStax, and in PyPi.  Not yet in Ubuntu / Fedora.

However, this is only going to be an _optional_ requirement.  If users do not
enable the Cassandra backend for Ceilometer, they will not use it.  As such,
this is a weaker requirement for packaging OpenStack.

Indeed, it would likely be inappropriate to install the Cassandra driver as part
of a default OpenStack distro, as Cassandra is not a primary datastore for any
OpenStack project.

As such, I do not believe we are requiring the distros to package it.  They may
choose to do so for the convenience of their users, but that is their choice.

> Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
> global-requirements.txt?

No

Change-Id: I5803f93be601b875fdfb8276c04e7ecebab8d08e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-16 05:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_ml2_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': "Guard against concurrent port removal in DVR

The delete_csnat_router_interface_ports method constructs
a generator expression to retrieve the ports attached
to a router. If a concurrent process manages to delete
one of the ports referenced in the generator from the DB
after it is constructed (but before iteration), some of the
ports will be None objects on iteration.

This patch verifies that the port db object is there
before trying to extract the ID from it.

More details:

This is because the query expression[1] is evaluated immediately
at the time the generator is defined. If there are ports in the
DB at the time of this evaluation, RouterPort objects will be
prepared to be iterated over. However, before the iteration over the
generator happens, something else may delete the port from the DB.
If that happens, when the iteration starts and the 'port' attribute
is accessed on the router port, a SELECT statement will be issued to
the DB to get that port[2] and it will return None.

1. router.attached_ports.filter_by(port_type=DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_SNAT)
2. The RouterPorts table's relationship to the Ports table is using
   the default 'select' lazy loading.

Closes-Bug: #1381263
Change-Id: Ia371545d641aaa1cbaa0fd10cd233250ec5769e5
"}]
commit_message:
Guard against concurrent port removal in DVR

The delete_csnat_router_interface_ports method constructs
a generator expression to retrieve the ports attached
to a router. If a concurrent process manages to delete
one of the ports referenced in the generator from the DB
after it is constructed (but before iteration), some of the
ports will be None objects on iteration.

This patch verifies that the port db object is there
before trying to extract the ID from it.

More details:

This is because the query expression[1] is evaluated immediately
at the time the generator is defined. If there are ports in the
DB at the time of this evaluation, RouterPort objects will be
prepared to be iterated over. However, before the iteration over the
generator happens, something else may delete the port from the DB.
If that happens, when the iteration starts and the 'port' attribute
is accessed on the router port, a SELECT statement will be issued to
the DB to get that port[2] and it will return None.

1. router.attached_ports.filter_by(port_type=DEVICE_OWNER_DVR_SNAT)
2. The RouterPorts table's relationship to the Ports table is using
   the default 'select' lazy loading.

Closes-Bug: #1381263
Change-Id: Ia371545d641aaa1cbaa0fd10cd233250ec5769e5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-19 23:13:53.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py'], 'message': 'Remove single occurrence of lost-exception warning

Returning within a finally block can be surprising since the finally
block will "hijack" the regular return flow.  In this case, pylint is
trying to warn us that the return-within-finally would discard the
earlier caught exception.  For this particular function we don't care
that the exception is lost, so the existing code is correct but possibly
confusing.

Our options are:
1. Disable the lost-exception warning for this function
2. Rewrite the function to avoid return-within-finally

This change takes approach (2), since the required change is trivial.

This change also enables the corresponding pylint check now that the
only offending case has been removed.

Change-Id: If1706851b4bd67ebdbbdb3485984773598efdf7a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove single occurrence of lost-exception warning

Returning within a finally block can be surprising since the finally
block will "hijack" the regular return flow.  In this case, pylint is
trying to warn us that the return-within-finally would discard the
earlier caught exception.  For this particular function we don't care
that the exception is lost, so the existing code is correct but possibly
confusing.

Our options are:
1. Disable the lost-exception warning for this function
2. Rewrite the function to avoid return-within-finally

This change takes approach (2), since the required change is trivial.

This change also enables the corresponding pylint check now that the
only offending case has been removed.

Change-Id: If1706851b4bd67ebdbbdb3485984773598efdf7a

commit_message:
Using Taskflow to refactor Volume Backup Delete

Refactor the volume backup delete code to use Taskflow
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TaskFlow).
Split volume backup delete code into tasks that perform
the individual required actions to accomplish the pieces
desired outcome. Implementing long-running operations via
task flows is needed, so we can better control the operation
process.
blueprint volume-backup-delete-task-flow

Change-Id: I029313cde65c0700cf714278fcbb99d64da69fc7

commit_message:
Using Taskflow to refactor Volume Backup Restore

Refactor the volume backup restore code to use Taskflow
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TaskFlow).
Split volume backup restore code into tasks that perform
the individual required actions to accomplish the pieces
desired outcome. Implementing long-running operations via
task flows is needed, so we can better control the operation
process.

blueprint volume-backup-restore-task-flow

Change-Id: I20e441ac95cd466ddedb703496beb66fc43f4e70

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-06-25 14:51:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/cinder-drbd-volume-driver.rst'], 'message': 'Cinder volume driver using DRBD

This BluePrint/Spec proposes a new Cinder volume driver,

commit_message:
Added a spec for volume type description change

The purpose of this spec is to address the issue of current volume
type's lacking of information. The spec lays out how to improve
the volume type by adding the description information and
allowing user to find out what is the default volume type.

Change-Id: I6d92cd327b60024ad7f067ddcfc32bf70952f58d

commit_message:
Explicitly specifies cm_api version in CDH plugin

We set CM_API_VERSION value in cloudera_utils.py, and in function
get_api_client, we add augment version to api_client.ApiResource
whose default value is CM_API_VERSION. Currently this value is set
to 7.

Closes-Bug: #1387960
Change-Id: I54e19c0c39357c410b070df1315ec3a7eb68740d

revisions:
[{'number': 35, 'created': '2014-10-22 17:02:37.000000000', 'files': ['tests/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/test_base.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/provision.py', 'oslo/db/exception.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': 'Reorganize DbTestCase to use provisioning completely

This change is the first part in a series of changes
that will allow for full flexibility in database usage
during tests.  The first step is to add more facility
to the oslo.db.sqlalchemy.provision system, implementing
a dispatch system that allows flexibility in creation
and dropping of databases, as well as moving the awareness
of the "openstack_citest" convention into provisioning.
The OpportunisticFixture and OpportunisticTestCase now
fold into DbFixture and DbTestCase, which defers in a simple
way to provision.ProvisionedDatabase for all connectivity.
ProvisionedDatabase in turn decides based on the given
environment as to how an engine should be provisioned
for a given test.

Control of database connectivity remains via the
OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION environment variable.  When not
set, connectivity defaults to sqlite://, plus those backends
found to be available using "opportunistic" naming conventions.
When the variable is present, it provides a semicolon-delimited
list of URLs, and only those URLs will be used for initial
connectivity.

Future changes will allow provisioning to hold onto a single
database engine per test run, as well as allow a single
test class to run in multiple backend scenarios (e.g. one test
against many different backends).

Change-Id: Ifc02505c4c8ebd4a1ca56e14f76c0989576875c3
Partial-Bug: #1339206
'}]
commit_message:
Reorganize DbTestCase to use provisioning completely

This change is the first part in a series of changes
that will allow for full flexibility in database usage
during tests.  The first step is to add more facility
to the oslo.db.sqlalchemy.provision system, implementing
a dispatch system that allows flexibility in creation
and dropping of databases, as well as moving the awareness
of the "openstack_citest" convention into provisioning.
The OpportunisticFixture and OpportunisticTestCase now
fold into DbFixture and DbTestCase, which defers in a simple
way to provision.ProvisionedDatabase for all connectivity.
ProvisionedDatabase in turn decides based on the given
environment as to how an engine should be provisioned
for a given test.

Control of database connectivity remains via the
OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION environment variable.  When not
set, connectivity defaults to sqlite://, plus those backends
found to be available using "opportunistic" naming conventions.
When the variable is present, it provides a semicolon-delimited
list of URLs, and only those URLs will be used for initial
connectivity.

Future changes will allow provisioning to hold onto a single
database engine per test run, as well as allow a single
test class to run in multiple backend scenarios (e.g. one test
against many different backends).

Change-Id: Ifc02505c4c8ebd4a1ca56e14f76c0989576875c3
Partial-Bug: #1339206

subject: Allow newer versions of pylint
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-28 00:39:37.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Allow newer versions of pylint

The .pylintrc used for neutron refers to checks added in pylint 1.3.0,
and aborts on earlier versions (from a quick experiment).

This change moves from a strict pylint==0.25.2 pin to allow newer
versions, as a first step to moving to pylint>=1.3.0.

Change-Id: Ia293eb1329f2c1c2894ab7d8d2142951e670fbaf
'}]
commit_message:
Allow newer versions of pylint

The .pylintrc used for neutron refers to checks added in pylint 1.3.0,
and aborts on earlier versions (from a quick experiment).

This change moves from a strict pylint==0.25.2 pin to allow newer
versions, as a first step to moving to pylint>=1.3.0.

Change-Id: Ia293eb1329f2c1c2894ab7d8d2142951e670fbaf

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: Idc4d6259d4eb2db66e7122535bc42f8647049a06

subject: Add _wrap_db_error() support to SessionTransaction.commit()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-26 21:28:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': 'Add _wrap_db_error() support to SessionTransaction.commit()

This patch adds _wrap_db_error() to the commit()
and rollback() methods of sqlalchemy.orm.session.SessionTransaction,
which is the object that is dealt with when one invokes
code of the form "with session.begin():".  The context manager
form does not invoke the commit() method on the
SQLAlchemy Session directly, and instead calls the one
local to the SessionTransaction.

In order to intercept this, we must build a subclass
of SessionTransaction with the appropriate wrapping, and
then patch it into the object that is returned by
Session.begin(), ensuring that it is compatible with
_wrap_db_error().

This whole approach is legacy; newer oslo.db versions
intercept errors at the point at which they occur
via engine events.

Tests are omitted here as we are relying upon the tests
that were added to the corresponding oslo-incubator code.

Closes-bug: #1370191

Change-Id: Ie0456e6daa86c99cf6fbe56ca5dfd8a618f14232
'}]
commit_message:
Add _wrap_db_error() support to SessionTransaction.commit()

This patch adds _wrap_db_error() to the commit()
and rollback() methods of sqlalchemy.orm.session.SessionTransaction,
which is the object that is dealt with when one invokes
code of the form "with session.begin():".  The context manager
form does not invoke the commit() method on the
SQLAlchemy Session directly, and instead calls the one
local to the SessionTransaction.

In order to intercept this, we must build a subclass
of SessionTransaction with the appropriate wrapping, and
then patch it into the object that is returned by
Session.begin(), ensuring that it is compatible with
_wrap_db_error().

This whole approach is legacy; newer oslo.db versions
intercept errors at the point at which they occur
via engine events.

Tests are omitted here as we are relying upon the tests
that were added to the corresponding oslo-incubator code.

Closes-bug: #1370191

Change-Id: Ie0456e6daa86c99cf6fbe56ca5dfd8a618f14232

commit_message:
neutron-db-manage finds automatically config file

This patch lets oslo.config find config file containing connection
string to database by itself. Config file can be overriden by
--config-file cli parameter as it was before, so it is backward
compatible.

Change-Id: Iacbcd65edfe9ef268a0caf80641e0937a99b06a7
Closes-Bug: 1381100

commit_message:
Fix uninstalled packages for ubuntu

1) bdsmainutils
Fixes heat deployment issues since puppet recipes improperly handle
`hexdump` presence.

Closes-Bug: #1389279

2) bridge-utils
Fixes the absence of `brctl` utility

commit_message:
Parametrize headless option for VirtualBox

If you need to start VirtualBox VMs without a GUI, for example, on a
remote computer, you can now set the 'headless' parameter in config.sh
to '1'.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1304345

Change-Id: I868fa67335506a5e048d37411f5d5795b560a338

commit_message:
Add cliff-tablib to requirements

cliff-tablib gives cliff the ability to format list and show output in
html, json, or yaml (http://cliff-tablib.readthedocs.org/). This patch
adds cliff-tablib to requirements.txt so that it can be installed along
with cliff.

Change-Id: I4daab97642482e6f40cd8209ff5edd9c680092c0

subject: Change default keystone auth version to 3 in test/sample.conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-10-22 09:05:16.000000000', 'files': ['test/sample.conf'], 'message': 'Change default keystone auth version to 3 in test/sample.conf

The functional tests devstack gate job currently skips tests
that require keystone v3 API. In conjunction with changes to
devstack [0] this patch will cause the gate job to use keystone
v3 API and stop skipping those tests.

Devstack sets auth version in its /etc/swift/test.conf by
uncommenting the value found in test/sample.conf, so the change
in this patch is sufficient to cause the v3 API to be used.

The devstack patch [0] sets the correct auth url for the v3 API
and creates a fourth test account that is required for the
currently skipped tests to run.

[0] change id I557de01bf196075f2f3adcdf4dd1b43756d8a0ae

Change-Id: I44e159b939f5e3fc3780612823d12262013ea793
'}]
commit_message:
Change default keystone auth version to 3 in test/sample.conf

The functional tests devstack gate job currently skips tests
that require keystone v3 API. In conjunction with changes to
devstack [0] this patch will cause the gate job to use keystone
v3 API and stop skipping those tests.

Devstack sets auth version in its /etc/swift/test.conf by
uncommenting the value found in test/sample.conf, so the change
in this patch is sufficient to cause the v3 API to be used.

The devstack patch [0] sets the correct auth url for the v3 API
and creates a fourth test account that is required for the
currently skipped tests to run.

[0] change id I557de01bf196075f2f3adcdf4dd1b43756d8a0ae

Change-Id: I44e159b939f5e3fc3780612823d12262013ea793

commit_message:
Pylint Fixes (bad-builtin, bad-indentation, duplicate-key)

Removes the following pylint exceptions and fixes the violations:
 * bad-builtin
 * bad-indentation
 * duplicate-key

This change prefers using all() and any() over allowing indentation
of complex multi-line if statements to match up against the block
that the if statement creates. This was previously solved by
double-indenting in several places.

Change-Id: Ic8705228515d6c07744004d6cf32764cda2611d3

The xen plugin does not catch all cases where upload can throw
an exception due to connection failures and timeouts.  This
change extends the try/execpt window to catch these cases.

commit_message:
Fix xen plugin to retry on upload failure

The xen plugin does not catch all cases where upload can throw
an exception due to connection failures and timeouts.  This
change extends the try/execpt window to catch these cases.

Also added original connect which in part keeps us from lazy-loading
the connection and logging of exception information so we can
figure out later what happened.

Change-Id: If643a7da9f602ab7bb5d255031a841c674fa6c6f
Fixes-bug: 1378903

commit_message:
Pool Manager - Central/Storage Changes

domains table changes:
- Added 'ERROR' to status column
- Set status column default to 'PENDING'
- Added action column ('CREATE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE', 'NONE')
  with a default of 'CREATE'

records table changes:
- Added 'ERROR' to status column
- Set status column default to 'PENDING'
- Added serial column with a default of 1
- Added action column ('CREATE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE', 'NONE')
  with a default of 'CREATE'

Other modifications:
- Modified domain object to reflect new attribute (action)
- Modified record object to reflect new attributes (serial, action)
- Ensured central service continues to work by setting status of
  domain and record to 'ACTIVE'
- Added update_status method to central service

Change-Id: I893f8e7834de4c6ccf3ad587af65a7eee24415b3
Partially-implements: blueprint server-pools-service

This proposal intends to discuss the best possible approach
for transitioning some of the Glance functional tests to Tempest.
This also helps continue our efforts for reducing Glance Gap
Coverage in Tempest.

commit_message:
Increase the 'all' timeout because slow tests are included

The default for tempest in .testr.conf is 500s. This was too short for
the heat slow tests so the time for that was increased to 1200. This
change is to a periodic job so if we need to it can be increased more
in the future.

Change-Id: If27ddef9865c54b997130c707382d2014d82e0a6

Without this logic, things using safe_encode, like cliutils.print_list

commit_message:
Restore python3 tests to safe_encode

The safe_encode function in oslo-incubator contained logic to decode
on python3, which hasn't made it into encodeutils.

Without this logic, things using safe_encode, like cliutils.print_list
in oslo-incubator, mangle output on python3.

Change-Id: If21f1de0e1c0a5fc000328ae403b458b551c02a4
Closes-Bug: #1390505

subject: Update swift content
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-07 15:49:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-install-config-proxy-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-example-arch.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_swift.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-finalize-installation.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-storage-node.xml', 'doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-controller-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-example-install-arch.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-install-config-storage-nodes.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_basic_environment.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-verify.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-verifying-install.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-system-reqs.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-initial-rings.xml'], 'message': "Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit ff5ef1b66a039549671ad99efa1de79fd52fc14e)
"}]
commit_message:
Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit ff5ef1b66a039549671ad99efa1de79fd52fc14e)

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: Idf4058a95420ee57183c3c55ac988bdff861c933
Closes-Bug: #1390375

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-07 14:46:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/multinic.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/multinic.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_multinic.py'], 'message': "Handle NetworkNotFound on addFixedIp API

If passing non-existent network to addFixedIp API, an exception
NetworkNotFoundForUUID happens. However, current API doesn't handle
this case.

This patch makes v2.0/v2.1 API handle this case.
This patch adds NetworkNotFound handling instead of the one of

Change-Id: I3851689e326182c0af2dca11a6b3b3c67d6c9e5b

commit_message:
Handle NetworkNotFound on addFixedIp API

If passing non-existent network to addFixedIp API, an exception
NetworkNotFoundForUUID happens. However, current API doesn't handle
this case.

This patch makes v2.0/v2.1 API handle this case.
This patch adds NetworkNotFound handling instead of the one of
NetworkNotFoundForUUID for readable code and covering additional
exceptions in the future.

Change-Id: I3851689e326182c0af2dca11a6b3b3c67d6c9e5b

subject: Allow jenkins to log into the host as root
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-07 10:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Allow jenkins to log into the host as root

The architecture under which beaker is used is that
the jenkins user will run a program that ssh's back
into the host itself. It needs root privs to do this.

If jenkins can already do that, or a different builder
is more appropriate, please let me know.

Change-Id: I5d05edb9d0f3e7a8b32981d7943019bfb5fea04c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow jenkins to log into the host as root

The architecture under which beaker is used is that
the jenkins user will run a program that ssh's back
into the host itself. It needs root privs to do this.

If jenkins can already do that, or a different builder
is more appropriate, please let me know.

Change-Id: I5d05edb9d0f3e7a8b32981d7943019bfb5fea04c

Added hook 'ceph::profile::params::manage_repo'.

subject: Fix storage.hbase.util.prepare_key() for 32-bits system
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3012, 'name': 'Dina Belova', 'email': 'dbelova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbelova'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6676, 'name': 'zqfan', 'email': 'aji.zqfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'aji-zqfan'}, {'_account_id': 7729, 'name': 'Ilya Tyaptin', 'email': 'ityaptin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ityaptin'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 13273, 'name': 'Lena Novokshonova', 'email': 'enovokshonova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'enovokshonova'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-01 06:54:11.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/hbase/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix storage.hbase.util.prepare_key() for 32-bits system

storage.hbase.utils.timestamp() will return long type object on 32-bits
system, which will cause exception in ceilometer/alarm/storage/impl_hbase.py:
'long' object has no attribute 'encode'.
Then developers on 32-bits system will never get local test passed.

This patch changes type check in prepare_keys() from int to six.integer_types,
which will work for both 32-bits and 64-bits system, python2 and python3
environment.

Note: no test code is added, because jenkins runs on 64-bits system. Reviewers
can download code and verify it on 32-bits system.

Change-Id: I57729ff67efe6d6036fe698e3d86491f9ed4600c
Closes-Bug: #1388181
"}]
commit_message:
Fix storage.hbase.util.prepare_key() for 32-bits system

storage.hbase.utils.timestamp() will return long type object on 32-bits
system, which will cause exception in ceilometer/alarm/storage/impl_hbase.py:
'long' object has no attribute 'encode'.
Then developers on 32-bits system will never get local test passed.

This patch changes type check in prepare_keys() from int to six.integer_types,
which will work for both 32-bits and 64-bits system, python2 and python3
environment.

Note: no test code is added, because jenkins runs on 64-bits system. Reviewers
can download code and verify it on 32-bits system.

Change-Id: I57729ff67efe6d6036fe698e3d86491f9ed4600c
Closes-Bug: #1388181

commit_message:
Use LC_ALL=C in openrc

export LC_ALL=C is required to avoid
'unsupported locale setting' errors then
invoking CLI commands in Ubuntu.

Closes-bug: #1390431

Change-Id: Ie980563025e9938f769ee0e16b629b8cf673d8c7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Update V3 client for server create list response

This patch updates the client which consumes server create responses
as the server POST response changes from the first server to a list of
all created servers in V3.

The Nova side change is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/54214/

DocImpact

Part of blueprint return-all-servers-during-multiple-create

Change-Id: I996dd1a46fd7048fe70e8f460176d0847d78d30a

commit_message:
Update v3 API tests for server create list response

This patch updates tests which consume server create responses as the
server POST response changes from the first server to a list of all
created servers in V3.

The Nova side change is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/54214/

Part of blueprint return-all-servers-during-multiple-create

Change-Id: Idad9f56e50928ecb3cfc241d3895c5d413521f86

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-31 19:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/migrate_server.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrate_server.py'], 'message': 'handle hypervisor_hostname target for live migrate

This change handles the scenario where a user might specify the
hypervisor hostname (long name) as the target host in the live
migrate api call. Currently, the user receives a 400 error
response ComputeServiceUnavailable when specifying "hostname.local"
instead of the expected e.g. "hostname" of the associated service.
The hypervisor hostname seems a reasonable way to specify the
target host of a live migration and users can be confused when
service has short name "hostname" and hypervisor has long name
"hostname.local" having success in one case and an error in other.

In this patch, we catch ComputeServiceUnavailable and check if a
compute node exists with that name. If one exists, we retry the live
migrate api call using the service host associated with the compute
node. If no hosts are found, we re-raise. If more than one host is
found, we raise HTTPConflict.

Change-Id: I8a952f0203617eb5d4314317fb00da67936a524f
Closes-Bug: #1310340
'}]
commit_message:
handle hypervisor_hostname target for live migrate

This change handles the scenario where a user might specify the
hypervisor hostname (long name) as the target host in the live
migrate api call. Currently, the user receives a 400 error
response ComputeServiceUnavailable when specifying "hostname.local"
instead of the expected e.g. "hostname" of the associated service.
The hypervisor hostname seems a reasonable way to specify the
target host of a live migration and users can be confused when
service has short name "hostname" and hypervisor has long name
"hostname.local" having success in one case and an error in other.

In this patch, we catch ComputeServiceUnavailable and check if a
compute node exists with that name. If one exists, we retry the live
migrate api call using the service host associated with the compute
node. If no hosts are found, we re-raise. If more than one host is
found, we raise HTTPConflict.

Change-Id: I8a952f0203617eb5d4314317fb00da67936a524f
Closes-Bug: #1310340

commit_message:
Return all servers from server create V3 API

The server create API currently returns only one server (the first)
even when multiple servers are requested. In V3, we can change the
API to return a list of servers.

This change returns a list of servers:

{"servers": [...]}

in the post response instead of only the first server:

{"server": {...}}.

It also removes "location" from the response as each server in the
list has links.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint return-all-servers-during-multiple-create

Change-Id: I5c833731f1516c8256f835e21cc22fd613bc57ba

commit_message:
Just use int(BOOL) to convert to 1 or 0

(This is split out from I24461f4328e188c8983ad574495e11e033ec5ba4 on
neutron, which was a hunt to remove "PRED and A or B" deprecated ternary
idiom.)

int(bool) already returns only 1 or 0 - no need to do our own explicit
version.

Change-Id: I4a26431337f746a9332beb0079e7ddf936253378

commit_message:
Configurable /mnt/state

This spec covers making the top level directory where persistent and
stateful data is written to configurable. Currently this top level path
is hardcoded to /mnt/state in our os-apply-config templates,
os-refresh-config scripts, and other element scripts.

Change-Id: Ifdaf31a97a76d69d89c0b5f48714cedfb3cf7b06

The delete notification currently only includes the resource id.
When ceilometer looks for this event, it expects more metadata

commit_message:
Send additional payload as part of delete event

The delete notification currently only includes the resource id.
When ceilometer looks for this event, it expects more metadata
like the ones included in create or update events. This fix
is so we include the necessary payload as part of the delete
event in neutron. There is a test_v2_api.TestNotification
testcase that covers this using mock objects.

Closes-Bug: #1315018

Change-Id: I351e79b741a1b842afc3486c067ce702160a0063

Force run of os-collect-config command on reboot

This enables us to handle cases where we need to assert ephemeral state.

This fix does two things:
1. Makes the L2 Agent attempt to retry obtaining a DVR MAC
address up to five times on initialization, which should be

Closes-bug: #1364215

commit_message:
Make L2 DVR Agent start successfully without an active neutron server

If the L2 Agent is started before the neutron controller
is available, it will fail to obtain its unique DVR MAC
address, and fall-back to operate in non-DVR mode
permanently.

This fix does two things:
1. Makes the L2 Agent attempt to retry obtaining a DVR MAC
address up to five times on initialization, which should be
enough time for RPC to be successful.  On failure, it will
fall back to non-DVR mode, ensuring that basic switching
continues to be functional.

2. Correctly obtains the current operating mode of the
L2 Agent in _report_state(), instead of only reporting
the configured state.  This operating mode is carried
in 'in_distributed_mode' attribute of agent state, and
is separate from the existing enable_distributed_routing
static config that is already sent.

Change-Id: I5fd9bf4163eafa321c5fca7ffb7901ae289f323b
Closes-bug: #1364215

subject: Update swift content
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-07 00:31:19.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-install-config-proxy-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-example-arch.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_swift.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-finalize-installation.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-storage-node.xml', 'doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-controller-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-example-install-arch.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-install-config-storage-nodes.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_basic_environment.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-verify.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_object-storage-verifying-install.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-system-reqs.xml', 'doc/install-guide/object-storage/section_swift-initial-rings.xml'], 'message': "Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno
"}]
commit_message:
Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno

commit_message:
Change default network tenant

Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

commit_message:
Add a new driver to support AMT as power driver

Introduce a new driver pxe_amttool to extend ironic's range to Desktop.
AMT/vPro is widely used in Desktop to remotely control the power,
similar like IPMI.
It will use amttool as power management and pxe as deploy management.

Change-Id: Id720628adcd4b8b2bc503c2ac44278143d657271

subject: Decrease number of retries for puppet deployments
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8776, 'name': 'Vladimir Sharshov', 'email': 'vsharshov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'warpc'}, {'_account_id': 8907, 'name': 'Dmitry Shulyak', 'email': 'dshulyak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dshulyak'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-11-07 11:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/deployment_engine/tasklib.rb', 'spec/unit/nailyfact_deploy_spec.rb', 'lib/astute/deployment_engine/nailyfact.rb'], 'message': "Decrease number of retries for puppet deployments

Default behavior before: 3 puppet runs for the
current role on the current node: 1 run + 2 retries

Now we will run only 2 times: 1 run + 1 retries

In 99 out of 100 cases, if the problem persists
when we restart puppet, it will not disappear after
next restart. That's why it makes no sense to run
more than 2 times. Thus we save time, follow the
ideology of 'fail fast', speed up deployment
process, show user more detailed message about
problem instead of 'deployment timeout'.

Change-Id: Idd4b2a2e7ecdeff9ec298a2c5ceaea91f74cee4c
Related-Bug: #1384332
DocImpact
"}]
commit_message:
Decrease number of retries for puppet deployments

Default behavior before: 3 puppet runs for the
current role on the current node: 1 run + 2 retries

Now we will run only 2 times: 1 run + 1 retries

In 99 out of 100 cases, if the problem persists
when we restart puppet, it will not disappear after
next restart. That's why it makes no sense to run
more than 2 times. Thus we save time, follow the
ideology of 'fail fast', speed up deployment
process, show user more detailed message about
problem instead of 'deployment timeout'.

Change-Id: Idd4b2a2e7ecdeff9ec298a2c5ceaea91f74cee4c
Related-Bug: #1384332
DocImpact

commit_message:
I18n

Keystoneclient didn't provide translated messages. With this
change, the messages are marked for translation.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint keystoneclient-i18n

Change-Id: I85263a71671a1dffed524185266e6bb7ae559630

commit_message:
Ability to flag projects to use non-standard libraries

devstack and requirements repo are being updated in the
following changes to allow projects to specify a soft
dependency for additional libraries not specified in
global-requirements. In this review, we enable a project
to specify the flag in a project/job's yml file and
pass the flag along down to devstack

Depends-On: I4aa606514131b5dde67d87f5c8db5a3f3e50fc03
Depends-On: I1f195ef9ff1509659848e14ec9936ff6f66a6496

subject: Have resource CRUD return self to simplify the proxies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-01 19:50:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Have resource CRUD return self to simplify the proxies

Instead of:
    def create_project(self, **data):
        obj = project.Project(**data)
        obj.create(self.session)
        return obj

We can:
    def create_project(self, **data):
        return project.Project(**data).create(self.session)

Change-Id: Ifbb41c7d1de461c80ea98b2c3d2e715da770a07f
'}]

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-07 08:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_minimum_basic.py'], 'message': "Add wait for async secgroup add to minimum basic scenario

Security group add actions are asynchronous so we can't assume that
the security will be available immediately to ssh into the server.
This commit fixes the issue by adding a wait for the secgroup to show
up in the server before we move on.

Fixes-bug: 1390355
Change-Id: Idd561d77ce2e4b83421bb7bfb6327a6c940b62ed
"}]
commit_message:
Add wait for async secgroup add to minimum basic scenario

Security group add actions are asynchronous so we can't assume that
the security will be available immediately to ssh into the server.
This commit fixes the issue by adding a wait for the secgroup to show
up in the server before we move on.

Fixes-bug: 1390355
Change-Id: Idd561d77ce2e4b83421bb7bfb6327a6c940b62ed

subject: Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-11-07 07:28:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_huawei_18000.py', 'cinder/tests/test_huawei_hvs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_18000.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum
storage platform for next-generation data centers that feature
virtualization, hybrid cloud, simplified IT, and low carbon footprints.

This patch add an iSCSI driver and a FC driver for Huawei 18000 storage
system, using REST. We define a common module for both iSCSI driver and
FC driver.

Implements: blueprint huawei-18000-driver
Change-Id: Ied3ba32589ed78d233a588f6bcdb1cfb766449c8
'}]
commit_message:
Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum
storage platform for next-generation data centers that feature
virtualization, hybrid cloud, simplified IT, and low carbon footprints.

This patch add an iSCSI driver and a FC driver for Huawei 18000 storage
system, using REST. We define a common module for both iSCSI driver and
FC driver.

Implements: blueprint huawei-18000-driver
Change-Id: Ied3ba32589ed78d233a588f6bcdb1cfb766449c8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-10-27 18:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py', 'oslo/utils/reflection.py', 'doc/source/api/strutils.rst', 'doc/source/api/excutils.rst', 'doc/source/api/index.rst', 'doc/source/api/encodeutils.rst', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/api/units.rst', 'doc/source/api/netutils.rst', 'doc/source/api/importutils.rst', 'doc/source/api/timeutils.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Auto generate the API documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I21e516a80f20eb2d5965a5a63c7dfd2d231c67e1
'}]
commit_message:
Auto generate the API documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I21e516a80f20eb2d5965a5a63c7dfd2d231c67e1

commit_message:
Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

OpenStack project for development of a new service for using
advanced features of containers in combination with Nova.

NOTE: At the Design summit session, Nova core guidance was
to start a a new project in stackforge and evaluate later
(next summit) if this needs to be under Nova Umbrella.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I70763a48adbd93ef920885398a03d7f6b36f7c11

commit_message:
Add openstack_extras and epel dependency

* Required for pacemaker service provider wrappers
  implementation.
* Add Puppet-openstack_extras module which comes to replace
  puppet-openstack in upstream.
  commit sha: b0b83dbf4507db36220f9c04c68e4788109b1c4b
  Source: https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-openstack_extras
* Add a dependency epel module
  v1.0.0 db0cdeba51739e748c965974ec832acada227084
  Source: https://github.com/stahnma/puppet-module-epel

Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Change-Id: Ib607cd77d56e55489e2a855c7ca933b8eb9fcaee
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-04-08 16:44:11.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/templatetags.py', 'horizon/test/tests/utils.py', 'horizon/static/horizon/tests/jasmine/utilsSpec.js', 'horizon/utils/filters.py', 'horizon/utils/functions.py', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/angular/services/horizon.utils.js', 'horizon/templatetags/horizon.py'], 'message': 'Add a JSON loader in Angular

    In order to pass data between the server and the client without
breaking Django templating, a directive has been created which loads data from
a script tag with the type application/json. For security reason you must use
the JSONSafeEncoder for dumping the datas into the HTML in order to avoid XSS.

    It provides a json_angular template tag which inject JSON data in a safe
way and use an angular directive to retrieve it in the client.
    Usage is {% json_angular <object_to_dump> <id_of_the_object>%} where the
object will be dumped by horizon.utils.functions.JSONSafeEncoder and the id
could be a string or a value which will be interpolated by the django template
renderer.

Change-Id: Ica3dced5470b66934eaffd68dc85fcac3612c1c9
Implements: blueprint horizon-angular
'}]
commit_message:
Add a JSON loader in Angular

    In order to pass data between the server and the client without
breaking Django templating, a directive has been created which loads data from
a script tag with the type application/json. For security reason you must use
the JSONSafeEncoder for dumping the datas into the HTML in order to avoid XSS.

    It provides a json_angular template tag which inject JSON data in a safe
way and use an angular directive to retrieve it in the client.
    Usage is {% json_angular <object_to_dump> <id_of_the_object>%} where the
object will be dumped by horizon.utils.functions.JSONSafeEncoder and the id
could be a string or a value which will be interpolated by the django template
renderer.

Change-Id: Ica3dced5470b66934eaffd68dc85fcac3612c1c9
Implements: blueprint horizon-angular

commit_message:
New service provider

* Rewrite pacemaker service provider
* Auto-disable basic non-ha service
* Uses p_ prefix if needed
* Look for master to start for multistate resources
* Includes debugging console and specs
* Print debug status on timeout

Related-Blueprint: pacemaker-improvements
Change-Id: I712e52acc5127f02838b88eaf99e6e63a0812897

commit_message:
Use separate pid files for Pacemaker OCF

W/o this change, improved pacemaker provider
would not differ OS-aware service pid file from
its own one. That would make impossible to
disable OS-aware services inside pcs provider.

The solution is to separate OS-aware layer from
pacemaker OCF one for pid/run/lock files (we use
only pid files in OCF scripts):

* Unify $OCF_RESKEY_pid_default definitions with
  $HA_RSCTMP and "$__SCRIPT_NAME" varaibles
* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.
* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $__SCRIPT_NAME to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.
* For status actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories
* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf
* Add debug for pid file related actoins
* Make empty pidfile checks
* Fix pidfile creation on start action of neutron
  agents OCF
* Fix pidfile deletion on stop action for mysql OCF

DocImpact
Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove old basic service_disables

* Remove *_stopped/*_disabled services definitions
  * RabbitMQ
  * Heat Engine
  * Galera
* Use clear titles for services and use name if service
  name should be changed (e.g from params.pp)
* Fix mangling for corosync services.

Related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Iedd11984f43f0d653526113ac208470aa4f39a94

commit_message:
Fix WSGI unittests on systems without IPv6

Test test_start_random_port_with_ipv6 and test_app_using_ipv6_and_ssl
fail when IPv6 is either disabled or not available on the system.
This patch skips the test if the wsgi server can't be started due
to ipv6 address assignment error.

Closes-Bug: 1174404
Change-Id: I5ada25ca6ba191a566a45bfba1a6703db09f273e

commit_message:
Propose: Add cinder volume drivers for Violin Memory storage arrays

A new set of Cinder drivers are required to support Violin Memory
storage arrays.  Both ISCSI and Fibrechannel should be supported.  The
design would be very similar to other SAN-type devices from other
contributors.

Related to blueprint violinmemory-v6000-storage-drivers

Change-Id: I918550782d11cfab72ad7b8951f88a14a8942633

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-28 22:58:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix nova-compute start issue after evacuate

After evacuated successfully, and restarting the failed
host to get it back, Nova will call init_host() and then
call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method
_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.
So Nova will attempt to delete the shared block storage,
which will fail since it's used by the new instance. This
patch fixes this issue and adds test cases for that.

Closes-Bug: 1385484

Change-Id: I71bb818f3c2930b3a2ddf1817dfd4bb61fae7e98
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-compute start issue after evacuate

After evacuated successfully, and restarting the failed
host to get it back, Nova will call init_host() and then
call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method
_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.
So Nova will attempt to delete the shared block storage,
which will fail since it's used by the new instance. This
patch fixes this issue and adds test cases for that.

Closes-Bug: 1385484

Change-Id: I71bb818f3c2930b3a2ddf1817dfd4bb61fae7e98

Currently there is no built-in way in Rally to see the differences
between two verification runs. This feature adds a compare sub-command
to rally verify that takes two verification IDs as input and output the
differences between two verifications in the desired format, html, csv,
json or pprint. Output may be printed to std out or directed to file

- Add compare sub-command to rally verify.
- Add ability to specify output format and file name of comparison
  report.

Implements: blueprint tempest-compare

commit_message:
Add ability to compare two verification results

Currently there is no built-in way in Rally to see the differences
between two verification runs. This feature adds a compare sub-command
to rally verify that takes two verification IDs as input and output the
differences between two verifications in the desired format, html, csv,
json or pprint. Output may be printed to std out or directed to file
destination specified.

Tasks
- Add compare sub-command to rally verify.
- Add ability to specify output format and file name of comparison
  report.
  Initial support will allow for output to either HTML, pretty print
  or CSV.
- Create rally/verification/verifiers/tempest/diff.py that handles all
  the comparing and output of results.
- Create required mako template (compare.mako) and renderer
  (compare2html.py) class for HTML output.
- Added percentage threshold argument for determining execution time
  differences

Change-Id: I0276e431d7d1ad89b1b28306cd0e0ea7e1174217
Implements: blueprint tempest-compare

commit_message:
Confirm Dialog for Delete operation in Network Topology

When we click a delete button in network topology, the corresponding
delete operation is issued immediately. Now, a confirm dialog is
displayed first to confirm the user's action and then the item gets
deleted accordingly. It brings better consistency with delete
operations of other tables.

Change-Id: I2d6d2aab092d99ab536c84b56fb79a2dac37fd9a
Closes-Bug: #1242251

which should fail validation.

commit_message:
Validate nested stacks for resource groups

Currently we don't fail fast, even if there is no
resource type mapping in the nested template
which should fail validation.

This change will to recurse and do static template
validation both for OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup and
OS::Heat::ResourceGroup.

Closes-Bug: #1389104
Change-Id: I7accc3c0f121e238f915a92bbd209b7ec11533a7

commit_message:
Handle os.listdir failures in container-updater

While investigating bug 1375348 I discovered the problem
reported there was not limited to the object-auditor.  The
container-updated has similar bugs.

This patch catches the unhandled exception that can be thrown by
os.listdir.

Change-Id: I7eed122bf6b663e6e7894ace136b6f4653db4985
Related-bug: 1375348

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-04 16:16:42.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/cinder_common_spec.rb', 'templates/default/cinder.conf.erb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add default_volume_type to cinder config

commit_message:
Add default_volume_type to cinder config

This allows the administrator of a cloud with multiple backends to
define which volume is the default when a user creats a volume without
specifying a volume type.

Change-Id: I1bb94dc1283e50645e4aece600acc52ae17db56b
Co-Authored-By: Craige McWhirter <craige.mcwhirter@anchor.com.au>
Closes-Bug: #1389292

subject: Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-28 15:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583
(cherry picked from commit 24c8cc53fd6a62fcad1287b2cdcf32d2ff0991d9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583
(cherry picked from commit 24c8cc53fd6a62fcad1287b2cdcf32d2ff0991d9)

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-05 21:00:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: disk_info should be passed to _create_domain_and_network

In order to start LXC instances, disk_info should be passed
to _create_domain_and_network for it to determinine if the instance
has been started from an Image or a Volume.
